title: Clingo bootstrap installs in $HOME/.spack/bootstrap even if that is removed as a config location

labels.name: triage
labels.description: The issue needs to be prioritized

body:
Workflow:
1. Want spack source code (clone) in a shared location for a team to interact with... put in `$SHARED_PLACE/spack`
2. Create a Spack environement `my-awesome.yaml` which includes  `$SHARED_PLACE/config_files/{packages,config,modules,compilers}.yaml`
    *  `config.yaml` will declare clingo as the concretizer
<details><summary>my-awesome.yaml</summary>

```yaml
spack::
  include::
  - /home/groups/coegroup/atdm-dev/atdm-spack/env_files/config.yaml
  - /home/groups/coegroup/atdm-dev/atdm-spack/env_files/compilers.yaml
  - /home/groups/coegroup/atdm-dev/atdm-spack/env_files/cray/compilers.yaml
  - /home/groups/coegroup/atdm-dev/atdm-spack/env_files/packages.yaml
  - /home/groups/coegroup/atdm-dev/atdm-spack/env_files/modules.yaml
  # add package specs to the `specs` list
  specs:
  - cmake+ninja %gcc@9.2.0 ldflags="-static-libgcc -static-libstdc++ -fuse-ld=bfd"
  - atdm-trilinos@master exec_space=serial host_lapack=libsci +shared+tpls_shared target=zen
```
</details>

3. Edit `$SHARED_PLACE/spack/lib/spack/spack/config.py`
```
#: Builtin paths to configuration files in Spack
configuration_paths = (
    # Default configuration scope is the lowest-level scope. These are
    # versioned with Spack and can be overridden by systems, sites or users
    ('defaults', os.path.join(spack.paths.etc_path, 'spack', 'defaults')),

    # System configuration is per machine.
    # No system-level configs should be checked into spack by default
    ('system', os.path.join(spack.paths.system_etc_path, 'spack')),

    # Site configuration is per spack instance, for sites or projects
    # No site-level configs should be checked into spack by default.
    ('site', os.path.join(spack.paths.etc_path, 'spack'))
#---------------------------------------------------^ bye bye comma 
    # User configuration can override both spack defaults and site config
    #('user', spack.paths.user_config_path)
#----^ bye bye user configs getting read in $HOME/.spack
)
```
4. Create a spack environment using the master yaml from (2)
5. activate the spack environment
6. do something `spack -d --verbose spec zlib`
7. spack will dump bootstrap installs into your `$HOME/.spack/boostrap` because it hates you
